channel.title: The Wyrd Ways Rock Show
channel.description: Welcome to the Wyrd Ways Rock Show. This is my attempt to evoke the spirit of The Friday Rock Show. I'll be playing new stuff and old stuff from all over the Metal world, from AOR to Black and from Folk to Thrash.
channel.itunes:subtitle: It's like... how much more Metal can it be?
channel.itunes:author: Carl Pickles
channel.itunes:summary: Welcome to the Wyrd Ways Rock Show. This is my attempt to evoke the spirit of The Friday Rock Show. I'll be playing new stuff and old stuff from all over the Metal world, from AOR to Black and from Folk to Thrash.

item.title: Wyrd Ways Rock Show CXCVIII
item.description: If you like a bit of Grand Magus, you’re in for a treat in this week’s Wyrd Ways Rock Show. Not only will you be hearing some tracks from their excellent new album, The Hunt, you’ll get my conversation with Fox and now former stixman Seb at the Damnation Festival in Leeds at the end of last year. As it was the first time I’d ever interviewed them, you’ll also get their musical choices later in the show. What else have I got for you? How about some new live Gojira, some new Sabaton and Counterhold, and a track from Accept guitarist Herman Frank’s solo album? By the way, if you’re in a band (originals or covers) and you want to be on the show, get in touch with me via the website at http://www.wyrdwaysrs.com, Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) or ReverbNation (http://www.reverbnation.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) and send me some files (or a CD). If I like what I hear, I’ll play your stuff on the show. You can also listen at the new time of 10:15pm BST on PlanetMosh every Monday, 8pm EST on RockStarsGlued.com every Thursday and Helldoradio on Saturday at 4pm EST. If you've got a smartphone, you can also find The Wyrd Ways Rock Show on the Tune-In Radio app. If you want to get in touch with me to ask for a song or take part in the show in any way, click on the E-mail or Contact Form links on the homepage.
item.dc:creator: Carl Pickles
item.itunes:summary:
If you like a bit of Grand Magus, you’re in for a treat in this week’s Wyrd Ways Rock Show. Not only will you be hearing some tracks from their excellent new album, The Hunt, you’ll get my conversation with Fox and now former stixman Seb at the Damnation Festival in Leeds at the end of last year. As it was the first time I’d ever interviewed them, you’ll also get their musical choices later in the show. What else have I got for you? How about some new live Gojira, some new Sabaton and Counterhold, and a track from Accept guitarist Herman Frank’s solo album?
By the way, if you’re in a band (originals or covers) and you want to be on the show, get in touch with me via the website at http://www.wyrdwaysrs.com, Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) or ReverbNation (http://www.reverbnation.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) and send me some files (or a CD). If I like what I hear, I’ll play your stuff on the show. You can also listen at the new time of 10:15pm BST on PlanetMosh every Monday, 8pm EST on RockStarsGlued.com every Thursday and Helldoradio on Saturday at 4pm EST. If you've got a smartphone, you can also find The Wyrd Ways Rock Show on the Tune-In Radio app.
If you want to get in touch with me to ask for a song or take part in the show in any way, click on the E-mail or Contact Form links on the homepage.

item.title: Wyrd Ways Rock Show CXCVII
item.description: For this week’s Wyrd Ways Rock Show, cast your minds back to August last year and the Bloodstock festival. You’ll be hearing interviews from then with Wolf’s Nik Stalvind and the boys from UK band, Imicus. Since Sonata Arctica have a new album out, you’ll also be hearing some tracks from them, also featuring some songs from that self-same new album. You’ll also be hearing new stuff from Slash, Delain, Grand Magus and Sabaton amongst others. By the way, if you’re in a band (originals or covers) and you want to be on the show, get in touch with me via the website at http://www.wyrdwaysrs.com, Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) or ReverbNation (http://www.reverbnation.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) and send me some files (or a CD). If I like what I hear, I’ll play your stuff on the show. You can also listen at the new time of 10:15pm BST on PlanetMosh every Monday, 8pm EST on RockStarsGlued.com every Thursday and Helldoradio on Saturday at 4pm EST. If you've got a smartphone, you can also find The Wyrd Ways Rock Show on the Tune-In Radio app.

item.title: Wyrd Ways Rock Show CXCVI
item.description: With the second anniversary of the passing of Ronnie James Dio back on the 16th of May, this week's Wyrd Ways Rock Show is dedicated to his work, which means a few cracking tunes from the man himself. Other contributions come from Attica Rage, Evile, I Am I, Wolfsbane, Black Sabbath and Velvet Revolver. You'll also get to hear from Dr Jim IronLord, with another Hammer Of Retribution segment and in this week's Shock Of The New, you'll get to discover Control The Storm, Element Of The Machine, Girlfixer, L'Endevi and Beyond Violet. By the way, if you’re in a band (originals or covers) and you want to be on the show, get in touch with me via the website at http://www.wyrdwaysrs.com , Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/wyrdwaysrockshow ) or ReverbNation (http://www.reverbnation.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) and send me some files (or a CD). If I like what I hear, I’ll play your stuff on the show. You can also listen at 9:15pm BST on PlanetMosh every Monday, 8pm EST on RockStarsGlued.com every Thursday and Helldoradio on Saturday at 4pm EST. If you've got a smartphone, you can also find The Wyrd Ways Rock Show on the Tune-In Radio app.

item.title: Wyrd Ways Rock Show CXCV
item.description: What have we got for you lovely people this week, eh? How about something new from Firewind and Falling In Reverse (for the young ‘uns)? What if we throw in a little Exit State, Attica Rage, Michael Schenker and Bull-Riff Stampede? That sound OK to you? Certainly does to me. What if I throw in a Spotlight on Nightqueen and a Shock Of The New featuring Stranger, Blyndsyde, Temtris, Shotgun Chaperone and Electric Boa? Sound good? Does, doesn’t it? By the way, if you’re in a band (originals or covers) and you want to be on the show, get in touch with me via the website at http://www.wyrdwaysrs.com , Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) or ReverbNation (http://www.reverbnation.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) and send me some files (or a CD). If I like what I hear, I’ll play your stuff on the show. You can also listen at 8pm EST on RockStarsGlued.com every Thursday and Helldoradio on Saturday at 4pm EST. If you've got a smartphone, you can also find The Wyrd Ways Rock Show on the Tune-In Radio app.

item.title: Wyrd Ways Rock Show CXCIV
item.description: This week, we commemorate one of the greatest Metal record labels as an era comes to an end. Warner Brothers, who bought the Dutch label, Roadrunner, have decided to close the Canadian, UK and Dutch offices, sacking some of the best people in the business. There’s quite a few people who aren’t happy. What else have we got for you this week? New stuff from Asia, Silverjet, Noctem and Jettblack as well as a Shock Of The New featuring Wulfshon, Death Valley Knights, Exodia, Charlie Shred and PelleK. Something, quite literally, for everyone. By the way, if you’re in a band (originals or covers) and you want to be on the show, get in touch with me via the website at http://www.wyrdwaysrs.com , Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) or ReverbNation (http://www.reverbnation.com/wyrdwaysrockshow). If you send me some files (or a CD) and I like what I hear, I’ll play your stuff on the show. You can also listen at 8pm EST on RockStarsGlued.com every Thursday, the Helldoradio on Saturday at 4pm EST. If you've got a smartphone, you can also find The Wyrd Ways Rock Show on the Tune-In Radio app. If you want to get in touch with me to ask for a song or take part in the show in any way, click on the E-mail or Contact Form links on the homepage. Remember you can also listen to the show by subscribing with iTunes by pasting itpc://wyrdways.podOmatic.com/rss2.xml into your browser’s address bar.

item.title: Wyrd Ways Rock Show CXCIII
item.description: Late again, but I do have a good reason. The new Europe album, Bag Of Bones, was embargoed until 30th April, so I decided to delay this week’s show until the embargo was lifted. You’ll be hearing several tracks from the album during the run of the show. As well as that, you’ll also be hearing new stuff from Circus Maximus, Anathema and Nightqueen. This week’s Shock Of The New features Weapon, The Dead Wretched, Burlak, Inverticrux and Skelectory. By the way, if you’re in a band (originals or covers) and you want to be on the show, get in touch with me via the website at http://www.wyrdwaysrs.com, Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) or ReverbNation (http://www.reverbnation.com/wyrdwaysrockshow). If you send me some files (or a CD) and I like what I hear, I’ll play your stuff on the show. You can also listen at 8pm EST on RockStarsGlued.com every Thursday or Helldoradio on Saturday at 4pm EST.

item.title: Wyrd Ways Rock Show CXCII
item.description: Here we go again with another Wyrd Ways Rock Show! This week, we Thrash it up a bit with four tracks from Aberdeen's Thrashist Regime (the original Scottish, not any of the foreign knock-offs!). They’re this week’s Spotlight band. You’ll also be hearing a little bit more from Tyrant and Bull-Riff Stampede as well as the likes of Keltic Jihad, UDO and Teramaze as well as a Shock Of The New featuring Venrez, Piranah, IamI, Jean Cabbie & The Secret Admirer Society and Grenouer. By the way, if you’re in a band (originals or covers) and you want to be on the show, get in touch with me via the website at http://www.wyrdwaysrs.com, Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) or ReverbNation (http://www.reverbnation.com/wyrdwaysrockshow). If you send me some files (or a CD) and I like what I hear, I’ll play your stuff on the show. You can also listen on Planet Mosh Radio at 11pm BST every Wednesday, 8pm EST on RockStarsGlued.com every Thursday or Helldoradio on Saturday at 4pm EST.

item.title: Wyrd Ways Rock Show CXCI
item.description: What have we got for you this week, then? How about four tracks from unsung German Thrash heroes, Holy Moses? They’re this week’s Spotlight band. You’ll also be hearing a decent chunk of new stuff from the likes of Allegaeon, At Vance and Shinedown as well as a Shock Of The New featuring Tyrant, Swanee River, Don’t Pet Hatchet, Iron Kingdom and Black JuJu. By the way, if you’re in a band (originals or covers) and you want to be on the show, get in touch with me via the website at http://www.wyrdwaysrs.com , Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) or ReverbNation (http://www.reverbnation.com/wyrdwaysrockshow). If you send me some files (or a CD) and I like what I hear, I’ll play your stuff on the show. You can also listen at 8pm EST on RockStarsGlued.com every Thursday or Helldoradio on Saturday at 4pm EST.

item.title: Wyrd Ways Rock Show CXC
item.description: Ran a little late this week. It’s worth it, though. You’ll see. New tracks from DragonForce, Heidevolk and 3 Inches Of Blood as well as a world exclusive play of four tracks from the new Keltic Jihad album. You’ll also get the return (hopefully not briefly) of Shock Of The New and an old song getting a bit of a going over in Covered. Not bad, eh? As you already know (or should), the website's at http://www.wyrdwaysrs.com. You can also listen on Planet Mosh Radio at 11pm BST every Wednesday, 8pm EST on RockStarsGlued.com every Thursday or Helldoradio on Saturday at 4pm EST. By the way, if you’re in a band (originals or covers) and you want to be on the show, get in touch with me via the website at http://www.wyrdwaysrs.com , Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/wyrdwaysrockshow) or ReverbNation (http://www.reverbnation.com/wyrdwaysrockshow). If you send me some files (or a CD) and I like what I hear, I’ll play your stuff on the show

item.title: Wyrd Ways Rock Show CLXXXIX
item.description: Holy crap! Not a good week, this week. Sonisphere cancelled, Sabaton splitting up... not good at all. There are bright spots, though, and in this week's Wyrd Ways Rock Show, we look at the good and the bad. That means music from the aforementioned Sabaton, Queen, Alestorm and the second part of Dr Jim Gets Hammered (also known as IronLord's Hammerfest Review... but I prefer the "Hammered" thing, myself!). Anyway, the website's at http://www.wyrdwaysrs.com... go there, click on the e-mail link or the contact form and say "Hello".
item.dc:creator: Carl Pickles
item.itunes:summary: Holy crap! Not a good week, this week. Sonisphere cancelled, Sabaton splitting up... not good at all. Anyway, the website's at http://www.wyrdwaysrs.com... go there, click on the e-mail link or the contact form and say "Hello".
